intro: Feddea, commonly known as the desert rose, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments, storing water in its thick, woody stems. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Feddea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
